programme.title: Dragons' Den S20
programme.desc: A wizard-inspired pair believe magical drinks and mini golf can cast a spell over the Dragons, and a nervous entrepreneur pitches an all-natural supplement that promises glowing skin from within. There's a sweet pitch from chocolate makers who've spotted a gap in the market, and a show-stopping demo courtesy of a pole-dancing mum who's turned a school project into a business.

programme.title: Make It at Market S1 (13/15)
programme.desc: It's now or never for multimedia artist Jack as he tries to launch his art business.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion and the teams shop for antiques in Nottinghamshire with experts Philip Serrell and Roo Irvine before heading to Bishton Hall in Staffordshire for today's auction. Christina also learns about the author of The Complete Angler and how his views on sustainability were ahead of his time.

programme.title: The Bidding Room S4 (10/30)
programme.desc: Featuring a £20 note with the Queen's head missing and a poster signed by Yul Brynner.

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival S1 (1/20)
programme.desc: Edith Bowman and Colin Murray head for a food adventure at the Stranraer Oyster Festival.

programme.title: Coastal Defenders (Tilting Jetty) S1 (1/8)
programme.desc: «Tilting Jetty»The Coastal Defender's dive team tackle Brighton's tilting jetty.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Highlights from the latest round of matches in Super League, including another big night for newly promoted Leigh, who host their local rivals Wigan at the Sports Village. The early pace-setters Warrington are at home to Hull FC whilst Catalans welcome Castleford to the south of France. St Helens play Wakefield, Salford face Huddersfield and Hull KR take on Leeds.

programme.title: Impossible S4
programme.desc: Game show in which 24 players compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day. In each episode there are three rounds, and the three highest scorers from each round play against each other in the final. The winner of this battle faces a £10,000 question.

programme.title: Eggheads S20
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts a general knowledge quiz featuring the greatest quiz team in Britain.

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Pubs That Built Britain (Liverpool) (n°6)
programme.desc: «Liverpool»The Hairy Bikers get groovy in Liverpool as they take a tour of some swinging 60s pubs.

programme.title: The Big Painting Challenge (Portraiture) S2 (3/6)
programme.desc: «Portraiture»Una and Richard take the artists to London's South Bank for some portraiture challenges.

programme.title: My Unique B&B (Toby and Islay's Sonar Hull) S2 (7/15)
programme.desc: «Toby and Islay's Sonar Hull»Simon is in Pembrokeshire to help Toby turn a sonar hull into a land-locked submarine.

programme.title: Your Home Made Perfect S2
programme.desc: When Punam and Anuj bought their 1930s home in Surrey, they thought it would be the perfect place to build a life together. But they now fear they have made a big mistake. Thanks to a 1980s extension, there should be more than enough square footage in their five-bed property. But most of the space is wasted. Architects Laura Jane Clark and Robert Jamison must rise to the challenge.

programme.title: Flog It ! S12
programme.desc: This edition of Flog It! comes from historic Haddon Hall in Derbyshire, where Paul Martin is joined by experts Michael Baggot and Caroline Hawley. Together the team pick out a selection of antiques and collectables to be sold at auction. Michael finds a glorious scent bottle, but will he come out of the auction smelling of roses? Caroline gets a glimpse into the past by looking through a stereoscopic viewer. Paul also takes the opportunity to look around Haddon Hall, where he meets up with the current owner, Lord Edward Manners.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games S5
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Kemah Bob, JJ Chalmers, Kevin Clifton and Victoria Derbyshire take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quick-fire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week, resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday. Will the winning stars opt for the much-coveted House of Games decanter, or will they be tempted by the House of Games kitchen composter?

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival (Leicester) S1 (17/20)
programme.desc: «Leicester»Sean Fletcher and Edith Bowman discover delicious treats in Leicester.

programme.title: Jay's Yorkshire Workshop S1 (1/6)
programme.desc: Jay Blades' workshop makes furniture to thank a liver donor and care home workers.

programme.title: Inside the Factory (Jaffa Cakes)
programme.desc: «Jaffa Cakes»Gregg visits a factory that churns out 1.4 billion Jaffa Cakes a year.

programme.title: Highland Cops S1 (1/8)
programme.desc: A bushcraft expert is reported missing in remote Sutherland.

programme.title: Detectorists (Christmas Special)
programme.desc: «Christmas Special»Lance hasn't found anything in ages. Russell thinks he knows why - the Curse of the Gold.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Kirsty Wark.

programme.title: Secrets of the Chippendales Murders (The Perfect Man) S1 (1/4)
programme.desc: «The Perfect Man»The Chippendales show takes off, capitalising on the phenomenon of the girls' night out.

programme.title: Great Australian Railway Journeys (Kuranda to Townsville - Part 2) S1 (n°10)
programme.desc: «Kuranda to Townsville - Part 2»Michael Portillo continues his rail exploration of Queensland.
